verses.roman:
dharmeṇa pālayann urvīṁ
prajāḥ śīlena rañjayan
vartamānaḥ samaḥ sveṣu
śreyaḥ kīrtim avāpsyasi

synonyms: dharmeṇa—religiously; pālayan—protecting; urvīm—the earth; prajāḥ—the citizens; śīlena—by good character; rañjayan—delighting; vartamānaḥ—remaining; samaḥ—equally disposed; sveṣu—to your relatives; śreyaḥ—perfection; kīrtim—glory; avāpsyasi—you will achieve.
translation: By religiously protecting the earth, delighting your subjects with your noble character, and treating all your relatives equally, you will surely achieve success and glory.

purport.content: Akrūra told Dhṛtarāṣṭra that even though he had usurped the throne, if he now ruled according to the principles of dharma and behaved properly, he could be successful.
